string.text: That creature—called the “pseudoflesh”—is not as easy to kill as a regular flesh. Many people tell stories about it and even though I don’t really care much for legends, when I saw the creature myself I knew then that most of the stories about it were true. I remember one time I was walking around garbage when I heard a cry for help. I crouched and slowly started to make my way towards those screams but then I noticed something was off… The speech was all slurred and I could barely understand what was being said. So anyway, I crawled up to that place and hid behind the hood of an old Kamaz. I looked out, and you wouldn’t believe what I saw and heard… That pseudoflesh was screaming like a human being. I wanted to kill it as quickly as possible, but I couldn’t get my gun out in time, and it escaped.
Interesting… and you think this mutant is here?

Yeah. I’m telling you, its lair is somewhere there. I can tell by its calm behavior. In that area, there is a small cave where even in very hot and sunny days, it still remains moist. The pseudoflesh is most likely in it. When we get closer, you should attack from the hill that’s located to the right while I attack from the left. When you see that awful creature, make it run towards me, and I will finish it off. But watch your back; there might be other mutants there.
Got it. Should we go now?
Yes. We need to move quickly and get rid of this threat once and for all.
Show me the way.

Yeah! We did it! We finally slayed the god awful creature. This is the creature. I am sure of it. Just like I saw it back then. Well, a deal’s a deal. You’ve helped me, and in return, I will help you. When I leave the Outpost, I’ll take you with me. Also, here. Take this. Extra payment for a job well done.
Don’t mention it. If you need anything else, you know where to find me. What are we gonna do now?

I’ll keep that in mind. Well, you can go back to base. As for me, I want to study this mutant a bit. Maybe I can take something that’s worth selling. When I leave the Outpost, I’ll send you a message.
Hey, merc! I take it you talked to Rasputin?
All right. See you later.
Listen, I can’t seem to find it… It’s hiding somewhere deep, and finding it is going to take forever.
Maybe someone killed it already.

I doubt that. If someone would have managed to pull that off, then we would be hearing about it nonstop. If there’s something hunters like doing, it’s bragging about their kills. If one of them would have hunted the creature down, then the entire Outpost would have known about it.
All right. So what are we going to do now?
We need to inspect the other part of this dump. Let’s go to the place where I first saw it. Maybe we’ll find it there.
All right. Let’s go, then…
You can go back to base. When I leave the Outpost, I’ll message you.
Yeah, I talked to him. Listen, Rasputin said that you, along with some other stalker—Savage, I think—tried to blow up the Monolith construction site. Did you manage to pull it off?
So Rasputin said that you and a stalker—Savage, I think—tried to blow up the construction site that’s occupied by Monolithans. Did you succeed?
No. I don’t want to talk about it. Can we leave the Outpost already?
Well, yeah. That’s why I came here. I’m going to the bar; I have some business there. And after that, I’m heading to Yantar. If you want, you can come with. I’m heading out right now; you ready?
Yeah. I’m ready. Let’s go.
Sure I can do that, but not for free. Money is not what I need, though. Instead, I need your help with a mission. If you help me with that, then I’ll take you with me when I leave the Outpost. Deal?
All right. What sort of help do you need?
I need your help with finding and killing a certain mutant.
Why won’t you ask any of the hunters? They have more experience with that sort of thing.

Well, the thing is that I’m hunting this mutant for the scientists; they’ve asked me to bring a piece of its flesh for further research. They promised to pay me a hefty sum for a job well done, but if I take the entire group, then everyone would want a piece, and there isn’t enough to go around for everyone. Taking only one person with me is also out of the question, as it can create unnecessary conflict, if you know what I mean. I’d rather take someone from outside our group and not tell them that I’m doing this in the first place. It’s better that way. So are you with me?
Sure. I’ll help you. First, though, tell me what mutant we’re hunting here.
Hey, Beast. What’s up?

Not yet… And I doubt I’ll ever forget about it. Either way, we made it out, and that’s what’s important. Now we can get back on with our lives. Soon, perhaps, I can see my family again. As for now, though, I need some alone time. I’ll talk to you later…
All right. I hope everything turns out okay.
Finally, you’re out, Beast. Man, was that Saurel guy stubborn, but I did manage to convince him to free you. How are you feeling?
Not too bad… By the way, the guard told me that Marcus didn’t make it out of the anomaly. What the hell happened?

Yeah… It’s true we couldn’t contact you or Marcus, so Forester went back to look for the two of you, but he only found you. I hope everything’s all right with him. Being trapped alone inside the spatial anomaly must be maddening… Let’s hope that c Forester reach Red Forest he can send Marcus the coordinates and he can find his way out.
Yeah. Let’s all hope he can find his way out. So how’s everyone else? Is anyone from our group still here?
No. Everyone left with the guide yesterday. You can’t blame them, though, after what they’ve been through. I won’t be surprised if most of them end up leaivng the Zone after this.
All right… And what about you? What plans do you have for the future?
I’m not planning to go anywhere anytime soon; I’ve decided to stay in the Outpost for a while and try to forget about that god forsaken anomaly.
And have you managed to forget about it, even slightly?
Looks like it’s over… Thanks, merc. We wouldn’t have pulled it off alone.

You shouldn’t thank me just yet. There still a chance the bandits could attack again. Saurel told me you found out about this attack by listening in on the bandits’ hidden radio frequency, right? Do you have a radio tuned for said frequency?
Yeah. Totally. We should check if anyone was able to inform the bandits about our ambush.
Yeah. We need to know what the bandits are planning.
Damn it. They’ve sent another squad here. What should we do, merc?
Don’t panic. You two should get back to your position and prepare for our “guests.” As for me, I’m going back to my sniper spot in the attic.
Yeah, yeah. I know that already. Just listen ’til the end and then decide, okay?
Go on, then.

I bet you know about the big Monolith platoon nearby, right? Well, these assholes have been a thorn in everyone’s ass for a long time. They’ve killed five of my guys alone. But I doubt I need to tell you how these Monolithians are a threat to everyone.
And…

To make matters worse, they’re always receiving backup and ammunition from somewhere, and their base is constantly growing. Soon, there won’t be enough room for all of them. They’ll take over the whole Outpost, killing us all off in the process. It seems as though the only option is to get out of here, but not long ago, we managed to find out who’s in command of the platoon. Werewolf is his name, but that’s not the only thing we know: we also know how to kill him without taking any casualties. And perhaps even wipe out some of his close friends while we’re at it.
Interesting… And how do you plan to pull it off?

Swiftly and quietly. Two days ago, one of my fighters pulled out a guy out of a Zharka. Well, he turned out be a Monolithian… and not just any regular Monolithian, but one of the high ranks in Werewolf’s platoon. We managed to get some info out of him. It turns out that tomorrow, Werewolf is heading to a meeting with some other high ranking Monolith officer. This meeting will take place in the factory with a minimal amount of security.
And you think two important Monolith officers won’t have good security with them?

I never said that. Obviously, the people guarding Werewolf and that other dude would be real professionals, but the thing is that this meeting is so secret that a regular Monolith soldier won’t even know about it. We need all the help we can get here. To tell the truth, at first, I didn’t want any outside help, but because these assholes iced five of our best guys, we have little to no chance of pulling off this operation now. That’s why we’re taking all the help we can find, and we could really use the help of a skilled fighter such as you. So what do you say?
I need to think about it…
No pasaran! Hey, Beast. It’s good to see you.
All right, Miklukha. I’m down with the job…

There’s no time to think. The meeting is going to take place soon, and we need to use our remaining time to prepare for the assault. More than that, though, we most likely won’t get another chance like this one seeing how the number of Monolithians is only increasing, and soon they will wipe us all out.
I knew you were a good dude. All right. If you’re in, then we should get going at once and prepare for the ambush at the factory.
Show me the way.
I can’t talk now, Beast. I’m too busy…
Do I know you?
Oh, yeah. Forgot to introduce myself. My name’s Miklukha; commander of this Freedom squad. As for you, there’s no need to introduce yourself. I’ve already heard all about you.
And what have you heard about me?
Nothing too good, to be honest. However, I do know for a fact that you are a professional, and I just so happen to need someone like you for a job.
What’s the job?
I need someone really dangerous taken out.
Sorry, but I can’t help you with that. I’m done being a hitman.
Greetings, servant of the Monolith. What brings you here?
We came here to strengthen the Monolith’s might on this earth.
We did not expect any reinforcements today… Where do you come from, and why are there only two of you?

Um… I was sent here by my priest, along with five others. We came here through Limansk. Our path was full of tests and challenges that the Monolith prepared for us. However, not everyone withstood the Monolith’s test, and only two of us survived. We were supposed to arrive here a few days later, but the Monolith showed us a faster way.
Bless the Monolith, for he is the one who helped you get here. As for your fallen brothers, do not fear. All is for the good of the Monolith.
I’ll be on my way.

Thank the Monolith, infidel, for he is the one who spared your life… If it was up to me, I would have killed you on the spot, but the Monolith forbids me to do so because he chose you for his trial. We are holding your friend hostage, just in case you want to save him.
You have Savage? What sick game are you playing?

Silence, infidel! I am the only one who is allowed to speak here. Our prophet took your friend away to the north. I’ve marked the exact location on your PDA. If you want to save him, I suggest you go there.
I don’t need your suggestions on what to do.
All right. We’re here. I’m going to stay in the village for a while. If you need my services, I’ll be here in the neighboring house. Good luck, merc.
You too.
Hey, merc. You need to get somewhere?
Can you get me to the metallurgical factory?
Not yet.
Sure I can. And since you’re doing Saurel’s assignment, I won’t charge you money for this trip. So are you ready to move out?
Yeah. Let’s go.

Hey there, merc. You the one who iced these bandits? I was nearby and heard some gunshots, so I decided to check what’s up. I thought the bandits were attacking stalkers again, so I wanted to lend a hand. Needless to say, there’s no problem here. What about you? You looking for something, or are you just passing through?
Well, we’re here. I’ll stay here and wait for you. When you decide to get back to the northern village, come see me again. Just keep in mind that I won’t wait here *too* long.
All right, then. I don’t think I’ll take long.
So, merc, are you ready to get back the northern village?
Yeah. We need to tell Saurel that someone killed Lefty.
Yeah. It’s a bit of a shituation, if you ask me… Lefty was a good dude, even though he did kill his friend.
I doubt Lefty’s the one behind Limp’s murder. Lefty also got killed. The real killer’s probably trying to tie up any loose ends.
If you say so. It’s none of my business anyway. We heading back to the village or what?
Yeah. Let’s go.
I was sent here by Saurel; that’s all you need to know.
Hey, merc. You need to get somewhere?
I need to get the metal factory again. Will you get me there?
Of course. You helped us, so I’ll help you. Ready to move.
Yeah. Let’s move.
Ready to get back to the village?
Yeah. Let’s move.
I need to get to the anomalous grove. Can you get me there?

I’d be happy to get you there, but the problem is that the place is always filled with either boars or bandits. I’d much rather just get you to the village that’s nearby, where it’s way safer. And from *there*, you can continue on your own. Or I can get you to the metal factory which is not that far off, if you like. So, what do you say?
A Freedomer by the name of Miklukha told me to come by; he gave me his coordinates. His location is way far off, and I need someone to show me a safe path. Can you do that?
So you’re that mercenary who was trapped inside that spatial anomaly? In that case, I won’t ask too many questions. Just tell me one thing: are you heading to the northern village by any chance?
I need to get to the old school. Can you lead me there?
All right. Let’s go to that village.
Tell you what, lead me to the metal factory and from there I’ll go on my own.
I changed my mind.
Miklukha? Yeah, I know the guy. He organized a small base with his buds in the old school. We can head out right now, if you like. So, are you ready?
Yeah, Let’s go.
Sorry merc, I can’t get you to the old school, seeing how freedom has abandoned it and I’ve heard that bandits have taken over that place.
Fine, forget about it then.
Yeah. I’m going there; I need to talk to Saurel.
Will you get me to the village near the anomalous grove?
Yeah, no problem. Are you ready?
Yeah, let’s go.
Sure, no problem. Are you ready to move out now.
Yeah, let’s go.
Wanna go together? I know all the safe routes around these parts. Plus, it’ll be less boring that way.
Are you a guide? Can you get me out of the Outpost?

No. I’m just a guy who knows the insides of this place but as for getting out of here, that’s a whole different story. The area around the Outpost is filled with dangerous anomalous and only a real pro can lead you out of here safely. We have a guide who hangs in the northern village, I don’t know if he’s there right now though. So are you coming or what?
Yeah, let’s go.
Hey, Beast. What’s up?
Saurel told me that Lefty’s dead. That true?
Afraid so. Rasputin, can you help me with something? You pretty much know every stalker in the base, right?
May he rest in peace… As for the stalkers here, Yeah. I know all of them. I’m the barman, after all. Why?
Can you tell me who this knife belongs to?
That’s Chemist’s knife. He was looking for it all over the place. He was really nervous he couldn’t find it; kept yelling and cursing while messing up the place.
Where is he now?
When he was looking for the knife, he said he remembered where he left and that was going there to take it. Give the knife to Chemist when you get the chance.
Hey, merc.
All right. I’ll be on my way.
Hey, merc. You wanna buy something or what?
You here on business, Beast?
So it turns out Chemist killed Lefty? Damn. He had us all fooled… At least that asshole’s dead.
I made him pay for what he did. Listen, I still have his knife… Maybe you wanna buy it?
I made him pay for what he did.
Hmm… It’s a good knife, so I’ll give you 3000 rubles for it, deal?
I’m not a mercenary anymore. What do you need?
Deal, here you go.
Nah, I’ll keep it for myself.
All right, here’s you cash. So are you in here on buisness or what?
Man, why you gotta be like that? Fine, I’ll buy it for 4500 rubles, that’s the most I’m willing to pay for it.
Fine, here you go.
Money isn’t the problem here, It’s just that this knife might come in handy.
Great! Here’s your cash. By the way, are you here on business or did you just come here to sell the knife?
Fine, if you don’t want to sell it, it’s your choice. I was wondering… Are you here on business or did you just come here for a drink? If it’s the former, I have some jobs I need taken care of.
Man, thanks for getting rid of that scumbag. I was wondering… Are you here on business or did you just come here for a drink? If it’s the former, I have some jobs I need taken care of.
Yeah, Saurel told me that you might have some jobs for me and seeing as how the guide won’t be here for a while, I might as well earn some extra cash.
Sure thing pal… There’s no such thing as an ex-mercenary. Everyone calls me Rasputin here by the way and you are Beast right?

Yeah, I have a job for you, nothing too hard… So, one of my regulars spotted a rare artifact inside the anomalous grove near the metal factor. The artifact in question is a Kolobok, and I want it. The guy who told me about, couldn’t get it. He told me that the artifact is located on the tallest tree there and when he tried to get he fell off the tree and almost broke his neck. Anyway, can you do this for me? All you have to do get the artifact and comeback.
Are you sure it’s still there?
I doubt anyone managed to get their hands on it, it’s not like we have many rock climbers here. I’ll even give you a Veles detector so you can find what I need more easily. So, are you in?
All right. I’ll get you that artifact.
Great! Here’s the detector and coordinates to that place in case you forgot where it is.
Got it. All right, I’ll be on my way.
Have you gotten that aritfact yet?
Yeah, I’ve got the artifact. It took some real effort getting that thing, what’s more is after I’ve got it, I was ambushed by bandits.
You don’t say? And what did you do?
Okay…
It doesn’t matter, the important thing is the artifact is with me.
Nothing, I just ran off with the artifact, and they couldn’t catch up to me.
Not yet.
You did the right thing, they got what they deserved. The bandits have really gotten out of control and this isn’t the first time they are robbing someone here. All right, give me the artifact.
Here you go..
Man, have these bandits gotten out of control; this isn’t the first time they pull this shit. Someone needs to tell Saurel about this shit.
Here you go.

And here’s your reward, just like I promised. If you find anymore artifacts bring them here, I’ll buy them from you, I take them at price higher than anyone else around here, you can trust me on that. By the way, Saurel said he wanted to see you.
Here’s your reward, pleasure doing business with you, merc.
All right, I’ll go see what he wants.

Listen, Beast, I know that Saurel told you to deal with Lefty but I doubt he is the want who killed Limp. They were good friends and they could kill for one another. I’ve never seen friendship as tight as theirs.
Welcome to my bar, Beast. Are you here on buisness or just to chill?
I had the artifact but it was stolen by bandits.
What!? And you let them steal it? I know you quit being a mercenary but this is too much. How could you just let them take the artifact? Yeah, I never thought you’d pull some like this.
I don’t really care what you thought… I’m not going to risk my life for your artifact.
Whatever, no point in arguing over it now. I should have asked someone else to this job anyway. By the way Saurel told me he wants to see you.
Okay, I’ll go talk to him, later.

Greetings, Beast! Listen, a stalker who hunts mutants came to the Outpost not too long ago. He said he needs a good marksman for a job so I instantly thought of you. This stalker is the leader of the group of hunters that hangs out near the wagon and his nickname is Hunter. Have you heard about him before?
No, I haven’t heard of him. That’s one stupid nickname by the way, a hunter named Hunter. Do you know anything about him?
So what? They were both dead drunk. Moreover, I’ve seen something similar happen before.

Oh, yeah, I have plenty of stories about Hunter, I’ve known him for a long time. As a matter of fact everyone knows and respects him… and some even fear him. He’s a good friend and partner and a good fighter. He has been everywhere in the zone and has been in it since 2006. He said himself that the zone is the best place for him. He adapted to this place quickly because even before the zone’s emergence he was a hunter. After he came to the zone he started selling mutant parts to people who needed them in the outside world. For a while he also worked as a guide for tourists who wanted to see the zone and hunt a few small mutants for fun. There’s rich people who would pay for something like that. One guy, an American, came here to make a documentary film about the zone. It was the first and last tourist lead by Hunter who died. Since then, Hunter stopped working as a guide for tourists. It’s also from where Hunter got his nickname. The American kept calling him “Hunter”.
What does he need done?
I didn’t ask. Why don’t you go talk to him and see what he wants?
All right, I’ll go talk to him.
Welcome to my bar, Beast. Are you here on buisness or just to chill?

I think that you’ll make the right choice… By the way, if you want to make some extra cash then bring some mutant parts, I can pay for them. It’s one of the easiest ways of making money here in the Outpost if you know how to field dress a mutant.
All right, I’ll keep that in mind.
Even drunk, Lefty is not the guy who would kill his best friend. Beast, I’m only asking to let Lefty explain himself before you ice him. Maybe he’ll be able to convince you otherwise.
All right, We’ll see how things pan out.
Well, he couldn’t have gotten very far. More than that, he’s still here in the Outpost. Although, I don’t know where exactly.
All right. I’ll try to find him.
What’s up, merc?
So Beast, have you dealt with our problem?
We haven’t even found out who even is the “problem,” so no.
What’s that supposed to mean?

Lefty didn’t kill Limp. I talked to him and I could tell he wasn’t lying. Lefty told me about how he and Limp got some good loot and that they were drinking to celebrate and when they were drinking they told a few other guys about their successful raid, hence Lefty isn’t the only one with the motive to kill Limp. Also, when Lefty left after fighting with Limp he was captured by bandits so that means he couldn’t have made it back to base. It’s very unlikely that Lefty is the one who killed Limp.
All right, Tell you what, bring Lefty here and we will question everyone who drank with him that night.
Listen up, merc. I’ve heard of your fine “work,” and if you try anything funny I will deal with you accordingly. Are we clear on that?
All right. I’ll go get Lefty.
Beast, where’s Lefty? Did you bring him to our base?
Lefty’s dead, somebody is “cleaning up” after themselves.
Man, what a scumbag… We got to find whoever did this as soon as possible.
Let’s not rush it, it’s not like we can revive the dead and if you we move to early more innocent people might get hurt. Don’t worry, I’ll find out who did this and I’ll deal with him, all right?
Yeah, okay. As long as you get it done.
By the way did you find out with whom the two were drinknig?
Yeah: Burnt and Chemist.
I’ll find out soon enough.
Don’t worry, after what’ve been through in spatial anomaly, I’ve decided to stop being a mercenary.
Beast, get to Lefty, we wil talk later.
So Beast, any luck finding the murderer?
Not yet.
So, Beast, any luck finding the murderer?
Yeah: it was Chemist. He wanted the loot to himself, so he iced both of them.

What? Are you sure? I never thought Chemist would be able to do something like this… He was one of my best and most trusted men, and what a piece of shit he turned out to be. Well… May both Lefty and Limp rest in peace.
What’s done is done. The important thing is that Limp’s death was avenged.
Sure… And how are you feeling?

What is this world coming to? I still can’t believe Chemist pulled such a thing. I was ready to suspect anyone except for him; I even considered putting Burnt in the cage, but after questioning him, I was convinced he wasn’t guilty. Here. Take this. It’s your reward for helping us out. You helped us get rid of a huge menace, and that’s worth a lot.
Thank you, and goodbye, this is probably the last time we see each other.
Hey, wait up. Where are you going?
I’m leaving the Outpost; I don’t really like it here.
Nobody told you?
About what?

There’s no way out of the Outpost right now, seeing as all the ways out are blocked off. One path has been taken over by Monolithians, who are constantly patrolling it. The second path is covered by anomalies, and only an experienced guide can lead through it safely… and our guide is gone right now. He’s leading a group stalkers through the Red Forest, and you’re going to have to wait until he comes back.
Goddamn it… All right, then. Guess I’ll have to be your guest for a while. Do you have any more jobs for me?
Not yet, but if you need work right now, go talk to Rasputin. He always has work.
I’ll go ask him, and I’ll see you later.
Tanned and rested. Your jail cells are like a beach…
What’s up, Beast?
It’s a good thing you came by, Beast. A few problems have popped up and I need your help to taking care of them.
What’s up?

We managed to find a hidden bandit radio frequency, so we set up a few radios tuned to it. One day, when we were listening in, we over heard that the bandits are getting ready to attack our base at night. They plan to free the bandits that are being held captive here. I think we need to stop their plan from happening, will you give us a hand?
Sure, I’ll help. What’s the plan?

The plan is that we occupy the village near the anomalous grove and when the bandits come three of us will take them at the front, one guy will take sniper position and the rest will shoot them from the abandoned buildings nearby. The bandits have no idea we are going to attack so that should give us a great advantage.
I’ll take the sniper position, I’m a good sniper; I’ve done this before plenty.
All right, I’ll give you all the needed gear. Anyway, I suggest you get ready because the ambush we are planning is going to take place tonight.

Sorry about locking you up in the jail cell but you are a mercenary after all. However, Savage vouched for you and told me about how you helped everyone in the spatial anomaly so I decided to let you go. Even though we are in good shape we could still use the help of someone like you and what’s more you kind of owe to my guys see as they are the ones who saved you from those bandits.
All right, Saurel, I’ll go get ready.
Right, go get ready.
What’s up, Beast?
So, Beast any news? Did you manage to fight off the bandits?
Both of your guys are alive, we managed to fight off all of them off, including the backup that came after.
We fought off the bandits, including all of their backup that came after. However, not everyone of us survived, Tailor died.
Great news, Beast! I didn’t want to interfere with the eavesdropping so didn’t contact you through the radio. What is this backup you speak you?
When we took out the first group, we over heard on the radio that the bandits were sending a second team to see what’s going on. They must’ve gotten spooked when the first team didn’t Answer.
Aight, what’s the job?

Ah, I see… Anyway, I doubt those bandits will ever show their faces here again. Thank you, Beast, for helping us fight off those assholes. Here’s your reward… Oh yeah, and you can keep the sniper rifle.
Thanks, man; See you later.

May he rest in peace, he was a good stalker. He would always put his neck on the line to save his fellow stalker. We should give him a proper burial… You said something about a second group of bandits?
Hey, what’s up, Beast?

Something awful has happened, about a day before you came here. Long story short, one stalker slit another stalker’s throat. They had an altercation that lead to a fight beforehand and after a while one of them was found dead. The dead guy’s name is Limp and as for the other guy, his name is Lefty. Your job is to find Lefty and make him pay for what he did.
Where should I look for him?
Can you Answer a few of my questions?
Ask away.
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about the zone.
Ask away, I’ll tell you what I know.
Since my first day, I’ve been wondering is the zone really expanding or is that just a rumor.

What do you think? Of course, it’s the truth. Way back when, the zone was a lot smaller than it is now. When the zone only emerged, it borders where north of the rostok bar. I can’t tell you where exactly, I don’t know but what we do know is that the zone’s first border was somewhere around the Army Warehouses.
How fast is it expanding? Right now there are plenty of anomalies here, were there really less of them here before?

You can believe what you want but a year back this place was devoid of anomalies completely. Five years ago this place wasn’t even considered the zone and back then the army had an outpost in the northern part Garbage, but after the zone started to expand the military was forced to relocate. Why it’s expanding so rapidly, that’s not a question for me but rather for one of those eggheads in Yantar. The zone expands in bursts, usually after an emission. Back then the emission were a lot rarer, they would occur about once a month and they were a lot more powerful than they are right now. The zone would expand along with these powerful blowouts however with time the blowouts started to become less powerful. Though the frequency in which they occur has been increasing ever since. Nowadays, we have a blowout every few days but it wasn’t always like that.
What will happen to the zone’s barrier? from what I understand it’s not the first border the government has set up.

Well, you got that right. The barrier in Cordon is the third border they’ve set up until now. They’ve started building it when the zone started to expand for the first time. Back then, a lot of people died near the perimeter, some died from the blowout but most of them died from mutant attacks. Nobody ever seen anything like it before, the amount of mutants that was coming from the center was enormous, there were thousands of them. The government in turn, sent everything they had at them; they turned this place into a warzone. Tanks, helicopters, artillery and everything in between were here to fight off this insane wave of mutants. At one point the wanted to carpet bomb the whole place but lucky for us the mutants stopped coming at that point. After that incident, the world started to take the zone a lot more seriously. Instead of restoring the old perimeter they’ve put a few pillboxes around Garbage and they didn’t stop there. In case a threat would get passed Garbage they would have a backup solution, the military outpost in cordon used to be that backup solution.

Why does the Cordon outpost look so weird? What I mean is why does it look like a military warehouse more than anything? Same thing with the wall they built around the zone, why does it go over the perimeter?

That’s because that place was never supposed to be a military outpost but rather a warehouse where all sorts of military technology would be stored and repaired. It was also used to refuel and repair vehicles that would carry cargo in and out of the CNPP. And after that wave of mutants that mentioned early emerged, the military took over that warehouse and made it their base. As for the wall, they only started building it after the blowout struck and because the engineers worked in a hurry they’ve made some kind of calculation mistake and as result the wall was actually built south of the outpost. Then, however, they tried to rebuild it so that at least the wall would cover some of the outside buildings and that’s what they got as a result.
Where are the gates though, when I was looking they weren’t there, just an open enterance.

They aren’t there anymore, they got rid of them. A few months ago a big flock of mutants smashed through those gates. The strange thing was that they were no blowouts that day. Out of nowhere a flock of boars and fleshed appeared and started breaking through the barrier, killing a few soldiers in the process. Then when the military called in a chopper something completely bizarre occurred, the mutants instantly ran away as if they knew a chopper was on the way. Instead of repairing the gates they decided to just get rid of them seeing as how they were going to build a second barrier anyway. Did you see it by the way? It looks amazing, a fine piece of work indeed. Everything there is as it should be: flamethrowers, mortars, fortified trenches and pillboxes, it’s all there. Hell, the minefield alone is a work of art, not a single rodent can get passed it. They must’ve spent billions on this new barrier, considering all the gear that’s located there. NATO takes its defense budget seriously it would seem.
Thanks for the info.

Thanks for the info.
What do you need exactly?
Know anything interesting?
Did you hear about the american spies?
Nope. What about them?

Well, a year ago Rasputin got a job off to escort three foreigners through the zone. He was promised really good cash, so he agreed. However, he is a smart guy, so he checked up through what they had in store for him. He found out through his sources that these foreigners were no regular tourists but rather CIA agents. Rasputin didn’t want to lose the cash he was promised but at the same time he didn’t want to screw over the stalker that would take the job.
So, what did he do?

He told me about his situation and after a while we both came up with a solution. We picked someone who could really handle himself, Elijah Muromski. That guy was tough as nails, two meters tall, huge shoulders, and strong as hell. One time he broke a boar’s neck with his bare hands just for the hell of it. So if you something would go down, he could handle it.
So, what happened then?

Elijah arrived on time and met the tourists after which he led them to the designated places. The tourists wanted to inspect the mutants from a far and take a few pictures and maybe even hunt a few of them. But Elijah could barely speak any English and he couldn’t understand what his clients wanted from him. They only thing Elijah understood was that our guests wanted to hunt down some mutants and so that what he did for the entire trip.
I think I’m starting to see where this is going…

No you don’t, stop interrupting and listen. For three days Elijah escorted our American clients. He went everywhere with this guys and showed them everything. In the Agroprom Underground they were attacked by a bloodsucker that almost killed one of tourists. In Yantar Elijah “accidently” forgot to mention that they were zombies there so when one of the corpses stood up, one guy almost had a heart attack. When they were traveling between one location and another he would “accidently” run into flocks of boars and other small time mutants. On the third day Elijah suggested they would sleep in the construction site that was located in Dark Valley, he of course “forgot” to mention that there were burers there. I don’t even know who was more sacred, the burers at the sight of Elijah, or the Americans who were dead frightened of the burers. When Elijah told us about this, our stomachs almost burst from laughter. That’s not all though. The next morning the tourists wanted to go home so they went to Sidorovich so that he could smuggle them back across the border. However the same day this tourist planned to leave, a group of three guys came to the zone, they were escorted through the border by the military. It turned out that this was a CIA group sent in to the zones for some kind special preparation program. Sidorovich was dumbfounded, why send one CIA group and then another one right after? He asked the tourists why did the CIA do this to which they replayed in broken Russian that they weren’t CIA and had nothing to do with them.
So all this time, Elijah was just scarring a few American tourists… Ha-ha-ha. Damn, that’s too funny.
Yeah, he almost gave them a heart attack. By the way, the real spies were also escorted by Elijah, in the same route. The burers were happy about it, ha!
Thanks, I needed a good laugh.
Thanks for the info.

Where are you from?
I was born in the Russian region of Sakhalin, in Okha to be exact. You know where that is right?
Yeah, I know where it is, it’s an island in the far east of Russia, close to Japan. You sure travelled a long way here, what did you do there?

Well, the town’s main export was gas and oil and even wood and I could always find work in those area. But since childhood I had a need for adventure, I just couldn’t imagine myself being stuck in one place for the rest of my life. At the time I travelled through every forest in the nearby region. When I turned 18, I joined the military. For me, it was the only way to get out of that island and see the world.
Thanks for the info.
How did you get here?

That’s a tough one… I don’t know whether it was a chain of coincidences or the zone itself choice me but here I am. Back in the army, I excelled in every aspect. I loved sports since I was a small kid so serving two years in a spetznaz wasn’t too bad. Even though, when I got recruited, the war in Afghanistan didn’t end yet but was nearing its end. I was barely sent to any warzones and didn’t get fight much. When the war finally ended, I was sent to military school where I got a military career. While I was in school, I met a woman whom I married. I didn’t have any kids though; for the best as it turns out. After I finished school, I would travel from one garrison to another so I didn’t have time for kids. After that I was sent to Chechnya, so kids were once again out of the question. When I was in Chechnya, my wife decide to visit me at the base. The base was attacked by Chechen terrorists and my wife was killed. Man, was I an idiot for letting her set foot in such an awful place…
Sorry, I don’t know… Didn’t mean to remind you…

Forget about it, it’s my cross to bear and I’ll have to live with it for the rest of my life. Maybe, that’s why the zone lead me to here, what do you think? I’ve been through a lot after the first Chechen war, so much that I can’t tell it all right now. Nevertheless, I remember the day the zone emerged like it was yesterday. You just can’t forget such chaos. In the first few hours nobody could even understand what was going on, people weren’t sure whether the reactor exploded, a meteorite fell, or this was the beginning of a nuclear war. Moscow was just as riled up as Kiev was. And that was when we were sent to the zone, I’ll never forget that day. I almost lost my entire team because of those bureaucratic rats. To them it was no big deal throwing soldiers’ lives away, considering they just had to know what those anomalies were capable of, bastards. How I, Dima and Sergey made it out alive, I still don’t know, the zone must have been guiding us. Anyway, when we made to the HQ, I was ready to shoot the general who ordered this operation. I almost did it, I had the gun pointed between his eyes but I was captured in time. After that, I was thrown in jail. If it wasn’t for my friends who helped me escape, I would probably be stuck in some Russian prison right now. After I escaped the military camp, I had two choices: either live in the zone, or spend the rest of my life hiding in the outside world. I choose the former. I rather live freely in the zone, than be rotting in some shitty prison.
Yeah, that’s one hell of a story. Do you ever miss your hometown?

You know, at first I didn’t miss it at all; I was too busy trying to stay alive. Back then, the zone was a lot more dangerous than it is now and it was almost completely devoid of people to boot. Even though, I’m an experienced soldiers and I’ve seen all the horrors of war, none of them could compared to what I’ve seen in the zone. When your friend gets caught in an anomaly, flies up in the area and gets torn to shreds, you stop feeling anything but fear. Nevertheless, you can’t lose skill and so I managed to survive somehow. After sometime, when I gained some experience and got a bit more comfortable here, that’s when I started to feel a longing for home. Nowadays, I really want to go home. See my parents one last time, I don’t even know if they are alive or not. I’m even willing to go sit in prison if in the end I’ll get to return home.
Thanks for the info.
